content: <@!583892532644151312> Optimism is leading the implementation, so I’d say yes from ORs, but I’m not sure how much ZK teams are aware/involved. That said, I saw in one of the documents about it that some things were designed to be friendlier towards ZK rollups too

author: tokey1475
content: I think it would be helpful to more concretely address the sustained bandwidth implications.  This came up for 4488 and I don't recall it being addressed.   I realize its difficult to address concretely without trying to predict the avg size of blocks with/without the EIP, but if 4844 has the potential to 10x+ network data usage, it is a concern for nodes with data caps.
